intro: Rhaptopetalum brachyantherum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit with small, fleshy leaves.
